thread.title: Rody leads groundbreaking of Cebu-Cordova bridge
thread.title_full: Rody leads groundbreaking of Cebu-Cordova bridge

title: Rody leads groundbreaking of Cebu-Cordova bridge
text:
Rody leads groundbreaking of Cebu-Cordova bridge By Mitchelle Palaubsanon/Freeman   President Duterte leads the laying of the time capsule as Metro Pacific Tollways Corp. chairman Manny V. Pangilinan looks on during the groundbreaking ceremony for the P28-billion Cebu-Cordova Link Expressway in Cordova, Cebu yesterday. FREEMAN 
MANILA, Philippines - Metro Pacific Tollways Development Corp. (MPTDC), a subsidiary of Metro Pacific Investments Corp. (MPIC), joined local officials yesterday in the groundbreaking of the Cebu-Cordova Link Expressway (CCLEX), its first venture outside Luzon. 
President Duterte was guest of honor at the event. 
“It not only symbolizes the future we are trying to get to, but also demonstrates the progress that we’ve already made to get to this day,“ Manuel Pangilinan, chairman of MPIC and MPTDC, said. Photo shows an artist’s perspective of the toll bridge, which will help ease traffic and improve the overall welfare of Cebuanos. The construction is expected to generate 5,000 jobs. FREEMAN 
The P28-billion project is expected to generate 5,000 jobs during its construction. 
CCLEX is an eight-kilometer toll bridge facility, the construction of which was pushed by the local governments of Cebu City and Cordova municipality. 
The project will comprise a main bridge stay cable, an approach viaduct, on-and-off ramps, toll plaza and secondary bridges.
